name: Sennheiser HD6xx
desc: My main choice for listening, but being open back I can only use while at home, typically sitting at my desk

name: HIFIMAN HE4xx
desc: My first pair of planar magnetic headphones, and let me tell you. I'm really enjoying them. Primary listening choice when I wanna jam out or when setting on the couch

name: Sennheiser IE 80
desc: My on the go ear buds and what I wear while following asleep. I typically don't like ear buds for long sessions, but these work well enough in the comfort department. Have been replaced by IE 80 S now.

name: WH-1000xm3
desc: For any travel or slightly noisy office environments, these are my current go too

name: Apple Airpods Pro
desc: For quick and easy use for listening to stuff on the go, or single earbud-ing it while listening to podcasts. They don't fit in my ears very well 😔

name: SMSL SP 200
desc: Really great amp, using the THX AAA tech making it super clean sounding. That tilt is very odd choice SMSL. 🤔

name: SMSL M100
desc: A decent entry level DAC, there's probably better for around this price at this point in time.

name: Hiby R3 Pro
desc: A great little DAP, though the software could use some love. Maybe one day I'll learn to build an OS for it. #ReasonsToLearnRust

name: Hart Audio Cables
desc: The inner connect system, build quality, customizations of these cables make it works it. If you think fancy cables make your music sound better, we'll I got news for you.
